pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:0.5: 53. The training rule on licking the bowl
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating licking their bowls. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.3: “‘I will not eat licking my bowl,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.4: One should not eat licking the bowl.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.5: If a monk out of disrespect eats licking his bowl, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.11: if only a little food remains and he eats it after collecting it in one place and then licking it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk53:1.15: The third training rule is finished.
